where I( t)= N− S( t)− R( t). As a result of this probabilistic formulation, the effective reproductive number is now defined as an expectation, that is, R
e ( t)= E{ βS( t) I( t)/ N}. The stochastic SIR model ( 7) is specified in continuous time, and we would hope that dt is very small. In practice, approximation to ( 7) is used by letting dt=1 or a unit of day, which is typically the smallest time unit used in public surveillance data. As a result, S( t) and R( t) at time t are used to approximate the average in the entire duration of [ t, t+1). This approximation turns a continuous time stochastic model into a discrete time scholastic model to proceed with statistical analysis. Other distributions, such as negative binomial or general dispersion family (Song, 2007), may be considered to handle the issue of overdispersion in the counting processes. With distributions in place, we turn the focus to estimation and inference by the maximum likelihood approach.
